title: How to Make Applesauce Cookies Using Cake Mix

steps.headline: Mix the wet ingredients.
steps.description: In a large bowl, beat the vegetable oil, applesauce, and egg with a stand or hand mixer.

steps.headline: Sift the dry ingredients into the wet ingredient bowl.
steps.description: Incorporate the cake mix and raisins/cranberries into the batter. For the best results and easier stirring, sift a small amount at a time in between stirring.

steps.headline: Form dough balls.
steps.description: Use a cookie scoop to form 1-inch (2.54 cm) balls and place them on a parchment paper lined baking sheet, about two inches apart from each other.

steps.headline: Bake the cookies for about 9 to 12 minutes.
Allow the cookies to cool.
steps.description: Leave them on the cookie sheet for a few minutes. This is to allow the cookies to actually "set" while still piping hot.

steps.headline: Transfer the cookies to a wire cooling rack.
steps.description: Set aside for about 15 to 20 minutes.

text: Making the Dough Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).  Mix the wet ingredients. In a large bowl, beat the vegetable oil, applesauce, and egg with a stand or hand mixer. Sift the dry ingredients into the wet ingredient bowl. Incorporate the cake mix and raisins/cranberries into the batter. For the best results and easier stirring, sift a small amount at a time in between stirring. Baking the Cookies Form dough balls. Use a cookie scoop to form 1-inch (2.54 cm) balls and place them on a parchment paper lined baking sheet, about two inches apart from each other. Bake the cookies for about 9 to 12 minutes.  Allow the cookies to cool. Leave them on the cookie sheet for a few minutes. This is to allow the cookies to actually "set" while still piping hot. Transfer the cookies to a wire cooling rack. Set aside for about 15 to 20 minutes. Finished.
sentences: Making the Dough Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).
In a large bowl, beat the vegetable oil, applesauce, and egg with a stand or hand mixer.
Sift the dry ingredients into the wet ingredient bowl.
Incorporate the cake mix and raisins/cranberries into the batter.
For the best results and easier stirring, sift a small amount at a time in between stirring.
Baking the Cookies Form dough balls.
Use a cookie scoop to form 1-inch (2.54 cm) balls and place them on a parchment paper lined baking sheet, about two inches apart from each other.
Bake the cookies for about 9 to 12 minutes.
Leave them on the cookie sheet for a few minutes.
This is to allow the cookies to actually "set" while still piping hot.
Transfer the cookies to a wire cooling rack.
Set aside for about 15 to 20 minutes.
